intro: Sidalcea eximia, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native landscaping.
